intro: Dichelachne novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea dichelachne, is a species of grass native to tropical regions of Asia and the Pacific. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along water bodies. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the grass family. Due to its adaptability, it can sometimes become invasive in certain environments.
